title: Trying to add a Ubuntu distribution (RemasterSys-ed) to a Multiboot USB

forumNotes.author: Jiew Meng
forumNotes.content:
I have used [Multisystem](http://liveusb.info/dotclear/ "External link") to create a multiboot USB to start my installs for things like Ubuntu \& Windows Install. It worked well but I recently found [RemasterSys](http://www.geekconnection.org/remastersys/ "External link") that allows you to backup your Linux for distribution, great for starting over clean. But it does not work with Multisystem, it fails with a message like > please provide a name for this disk It fails even after I copy .disk folder over. It boots but into a command line system, not the live CD How can I make GRUB2 boot my RemasterSys-ed Ubuntu Distribution? Entry generated by multisystem looks like below ``` menuentry "(generic) customdist.iso" { linux /ubuntu1/casper/vmlinuz live-media-path=/ubuntu1/casper root=UUID=E56C-B453 file=/cdrom/preseed/custom.seed boot=casper noprompt quiet text -- initrd /ubuntu1/casper/initrd.gz } ```
I changed spash with text, the get messages **Edited by Jiew Meng, 18 September 2011 - 02:24 PM.**
